channel.title: The Jeffersonian heritage
channel.description:
This series dramatizes the ideas of Thomas Jefferson, which are "the enduring possessions of all Americans and all free peoples," while being "authentic in historical spirit" and "imaginative in form."

An online collection of early educational public radio content from the National Association of Educational Broadcasters (NAEB).

item.title: Return of a patriot
item.description: This program dramatizes Thomas Jefferson's return to the United States from his time in France.
item.dc:creator: Papp, Frank, 1909-1996
item.dc:subject: Washington, George, 1732-1799

item.title: Divided we stand
item.description: This program dramatizes Thomas Jefferon's role in the debate over the establishment of the separation of church and state in the United States.
item.dc:creator: Papp, Frank, 1909-1996
item.dc:subject: Religion

item.title: To Secure These Rights
item.description: This program dramatizes Jefferson's ideas about the mutability of the Constitution and how succeeding generations must adapt it to secure their rights.
item.dc:creator: Papp, Frank, 1909-1996
item.dc:subject: Jefferson, Thomas, 1743-1826

item.title: Danger of freedom
item.description: This program dramatizes Thomas Jefferson's involvement in the development of immigration laws.
item.dc:creator: Papp, Frank, 1909-1996
item.dc:subject: Statutes--United States

item.title: Freeing the land
item.description: This program dramatizes Thomas Jefferson's time in France, as well as its impact on his philosophies.
item.dc:creator: Papp, Frank, 1909-1996
item.dc:subject: Labor

item.title: Nature's Most Precious Gift
item.description: This program focuses on the friendship and correspondence between Jefferson and John Adams.
item.dc:creator: Papp, Frank, 1909-1996
item.dc:subject: Jefferson, Thomas, 1743-1826

item.title: The democrat and the commissar
item.description: This program dramatizes Jefferson's opinions about communism.
item.dc:creator: Papp, Frank, 1909-1996
item.dc:subject: War & Civil Defense

item.title: Experiment of a free press
item.description: This program dramatizes Thomas Jefferson's role in establishing freedom of the press in the United States.
item.dc:creator: Papp, Frank, 1909-1996
item.dc:subject: Statutes--United States

item.title: University of the United States
item.description: This program dramatizes the creation and construction of the University of Virginia.
item.dc:creator: Papp, Frank, 1909-1996
item.dc:subject: University of Virginia

item.title: What the Jeffersonian heritage means today
item.description: This program focuses on Jefferson's legacy and its relevance in the 20th century.
item.dc:creator: Papp, Frank, 1909-1996
item.dc:subject: Jefferson, Thomas, 1743-1826

item.title: The living declaration
item.description: This program focuses on Thomas Jefferson and his role in the creation of the Declaration of Independence.
item.dc:creator: Papp, Frank, 1909-1996
item.dc:subject: Jefferson, Thomas, 1743-1826

item.title: Ground of justice
item.description: This program dramatizes Thomas Jefferson and John Adams' roles in a criminal trial and its impact on a young country.
item.dc:creator: Papp, Frank, 1909-1996
item.dc:subject: U.S. Government

item.title: Light and liberty
item.description: This program dramatizes Thomas Jefferson's debate with French thinkers over the virtues of the United States and the mingling of science and spirituality.
item.dc:creator: Papp, Frank, 1909-1996
item.dc:subject: Science & Technology
